channel.title: Why isn't my ::jail command working?

item.title: Why isn't my ::jail command working?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

when ever i use the ::jail command on someone, it doesnâ€™t work! here is the command code

if (command.startsWith("jail") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 1) { if(teleblock == true){ sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); //made by Musicmad441 } String name = command.substring(5); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; c.teleportToX = 3080; c.teleportToY = 3506; c.teleblock = true; c.sendMessage("You have been thrown in jail for breaking the rules!"); c.sendMessage("A mod or Admin will release you if they feel like it!"); c.teleblock = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

and here is the command code with unjail put in to it, which is what i have in client.java at the moment

if (command.startsWith("jail") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 1) { if(teleblock == true){ sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); //made by Musicmad441 } String name = command.substring(5); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; c.teleportToX = 3080; c.teleportToY = 3506; c.teleblock = true; c.sendMessage("You have been thrown in jail for breaking the rules!"); c.sendMessage("A mod or Admin will release you if they feel like it!"); c.teleblock = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else if (command.startsWith("unjail") && command.length() > 7 && playerRights >= 1) { String name = command.substring(7); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; c.teleportToX = 3093; c.teleportToY = 3491; c.teleblock = false; c.sendMessage("Ahhh!feel the fresh air!Do not break the rules again!."); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Read full topic
